trans-unit.source: Represents the key for an entry in a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCache"></xref>.
When caching a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken> there are two indexes required.
One is the context ID, represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.ContextId%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, that is unique across all session tokens.
The other is the key generation, represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.KeyGeneration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is unique within a session token.
When a session token is issued it has only a context ID.
When the session token is renewed, the key generation is added.
After renewal, the renewed session token is uniquely identifiable via the context ID and key generation.
Objects of type <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey> are used as the indexes to the session token cache.

An index will always have a valid <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.ContextId%2A> property specified, but the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.KeyGeneration%2A> property may be `null`, depending on whether the token has been renewed.
There is also an optional <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.EndpointId%2A> which gives the endpoint to which the token is scoped.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey"></xref> class.
The endpoint ID to which the cache entry is scoped.
This is should be the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.EndpointId"></xref> property of the cached token.
The context ID of the cache entry.
This is should be the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.ContextId"></xref> property of the cached token.
The key generation of the cache entry.
This is should be the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.KeyGeneration"></xref> property of the cached token.
This value is available when the token is renewed.
It will be `null` when caching a new token.
Gets the context ID for the cache key.
This corresponds to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.ContextId%2A> property of the cached token.
The context ID for the cache key.
Gets the Endpoint ID to which this cache entry is scoped.
This corresponds to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.EndpointId%2A> property of the cached token.
The Endpoint ID to which this cache entry is scoped.
Determines whether the specified object is the same as the current cache key.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.IgnoreKeyGeneration%2A> is `true`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.KeyGeneration%2A> property is not used in the comparison.
The object to be compared to the current cache key.
Should be assignable from <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey"></xref>.
`true` if the specified object is the same as the current cache key; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a hash code for the current cache key.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.IgnoreKeyGeneration%2A> is `true`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.KeyGeneration%2A> property is not used in generating the hash code.
The hash code for the current cache key.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether key generation can be ignored when doing index comparison.

This property affects the manner in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.KeyGeneration%2A> property is treated by the following methods and operators: <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.Equals%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.GetHashCode%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.op_Equality%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.op_Inequality%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.ToString%2A>.
`true` to ignore key generation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the key generation for the cache key
This corresponds to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken.KeyGeneration%2A> property of the cached token.
The key generation for the cache key
Implements the equality operator for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey"></xref> class.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.IgnoreKeyGeneration%2A> is `true`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.KeyGeneration%2A> property is not used in the comparison.
The first cache key to compare.
The second cache key to compare.
`true` if the cache keys are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Implements the equality operator for the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey"></xref> class.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.IgnoreKeyGeneration%2A> is `true`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.KeyGeneration%2A> property is not used in the comparison.
The first cache key to compare.
The second cache key to compare.
`true` if the cache keys are not equal; otherwise, `false`.
Overrides <xref href="System.Object.ToString"></xref> to provide a unique identifier.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.IgnoreKeyGeneration%2A> is `true`, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityTokenCacheKey.KeyGeneration%2A> property is not used.
The key in string form.
